bioghist.p: In 1982, the Center for the History of Chemistry (CHOC) was launched as a pilot project of the University of Pennsylvania and the American Chemical Society (ACS). In 1987 CHOC was incorporated as a not-for-profit organization, now named the National Foundation for the History of Chemistry, by joint action of the ACS and AIChE, the Center's third sponsor. In 1992 the Chemical Heritage Foundation (CHF) assumed its present name to better reflect the interdisciplinary nature of the sciences and industries it serves and the widening public scope of its activities. The Chemical Heritage Foundation is funded by contributions from individuals, corporations, foundations, and public agencies.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of development records created by several staff members of the Chemical Heritage Foundation from 1983 to 2001. Materials include: annual appeals; acknowledgment letters; donor lists; Development Committee agendas and correspondence; documents concerning naming opportunities, fellowship and lecture funding; and gift detail reports. The collection also includes administrative records maintained by staff members related to the running of the department.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
